text: The early speakers in the debate each severely rated the speech of his predecessor. These strictures were all too well justified. We started with the plaintive wailings of Mr. Healey, 'Shadow Foreign Secretary,' described by Mr. Godber, Minister of State, Foreign Office, as 'pedantic and obscure on Berlin, damaging and obscure on the Congo.' In turn Mr. Godber was censured by Mr. Shinwell, former Labour Defence Minister, for having read the House an ill-prepared essay.
handwritten_text: The early speakers in the debate each severely rated the speech of his predecessor. These strictures were all too well justified. We started with the plaintive wailings of Mr. Healey, 'Shadow Foreign Secretary,' described by Mr. Godber, Minister of State, Foreign Office, as 'pedantic and obscure on Berlin, damaging and obscure on the Congo.' In turn Mr. Godber was censured by Mr. Shinwell, former Labour Defence Minister, for having read the House an ill-prepared essay.
